instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Orange light, fan spin
threads.message:
[FONT=Calibri][B]<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>              L7095: 3.425 V (pin 2)[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>                F7140: 8.60 V


When I plug in the mag safe, green light (3 seconds), switch to orange
Then fan spin

This is both WITH and WITHOUT battery attached

ON the DC in board, I think I identified the "one wire" circuit components

<CHIP>U6900</CHIP>
1: 3.425V
2: GND
4: 3.40V
5: 3.40 V

<CHIP>U6901</CHIP>

1: 3.395 V
2: 3.395 V
4: 3.426 V[/B][/FONT]
[FONT=Calibri][B]5: 3.426 V


DC in board fuse : 14.92 V (? F6905 equivalent)

My question is what direction to go in to solve the issue of the switch to the orange light.[/B][/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Orange light, fan spin
threads.message:
""[FONT=Calibri][B]what direction to go in to solve the issue of the switch to the orange light
Which issue???
That is normal behaviour...[/B][/FONT]

Fan spin, nothing more?
Do you get VCORE?
Did you test USB activity?
